Summary A seasoned, versatile and hands-on IT professional who has served as a product manager, business analyst, solutions architect, project manager and software developer; specialized in enterprise services, IOT architecture, API design and monetization. 
- Strong analytical and problem solving skills 
- Working directly with customers to discern and elicit requirements  
- Solid background in the Telecom and Payment industries 
- High quality of work 
- Investigative and eager to discover new technologies 
 
Specialties: 
Customer-led product management, product roadmap, requirement elicitation, business case analysis, product features vs. point solutions, Business Process Modeling (BPMN), UML. 
Java development, API design, Service exposure, Identity Providers, Authorization and Authentication (OAuth2, SAML), eCommerce, Camel integration framework.

Summary 20 plus years of software product and solution experience in varying front-end roles including requirement analysis, product marketing, product management, project management, testing, pre-sales support, architectural design, and generation of requirement documents.  
 Demonstrated experience communicating technical, delivery, and financial information to global customers and senior level management.  
 Excellent Project Management skills. Excellent team building and leadership skills. Strong written, oral and presentation skills. Proven ability to successfully lead and motivate cross-functional teams. Multi-site and multi-cultural experience. Ability to work on and track multiple projects simultaneously and to accommodate a rapid rate of change in technology. 
 Excellent problem solving, research and analysis skills. Proven skills in pre-sales presentations, collaborating on technical approaches, working bid/proposal phase, and opportunity funnel management skills. Experience working with teams to define requirements, create proposals, and generate white papers. Specialties:Detailed knowledge of wireless, voice, data, and information technology and protocols including: CDMA, LTE, WCDMA, GSM, IMS, SIP, H.323, SMTP, SNMP, IMAP4, REST, XML, SS7, ISDN, LDAP, SMPP, SOAP, and Diameter. Experience Senior Solutions Architect Intel Corporation June 2011  – Present (4 years 3 months) Greater Boston Area Manager of Solution Architects Comverse February 2007  –  June 2011  (4 years 5 months) Greater Boston Area Led a group of over 15 Solution Managers which provided solutions to over 100 pre-sales opportunities and over 25 projects each year for the Americas Division. 
The group provided engineering support for sales opportunities, designed technical solutions for inclusion in customer proposals, and delivered engineering services to ongoing projects. 
 Pre-sales support included determining gaps between customer requirements and Comverse products, proposing solutions, developing architectures, gathering development costs and gathering the estimated time required to implement the functionality 
 Post-sales support included creation of requirement documents and on-going technical support  
Technical lead for opportunities involving integration of multiple products including a recent win of over $5 M dollars. 
Led a task force to document and re-engineer workflow processes and roles/responsibilities for all types of pre-sales customer engagement.  
Created and presented opportunity reviews of deals over $5M to senior management covering technical aspects, financial costs, schedules and risks.  
Created a model for forecasting the group’s yearly staffing needs which was used to justify staffing levels and the requested travel budget. 
Reviewed process for evaluation and selection of partners. 
Managed multiple teams where each team covered different functional areas. Manager of AmericasTechnology Office Comverse October 2002  –  February 2007  (4 years 5 months) Pre-sales support for new products which included wins with several Tier 1 customers of over $10M. 
Led a cross-functional team which defined and implemented a new business process which defined the America’s Division front-end sales process.  
Created presentations showing the future technological direction and Comverse product fit and presented them to CXO and senior technical groups. 
Consulted with account teams on the technical aspects of market trends & technologies to create business development strategies including analysis of competitors solutions. Manager of Project Managers and System Engineering Comverse August 1996  –  October 2002  (6 years 3 months) Improved the project initiation planning process which increased the accuracy of schedules and resource estimates. 
Established a project gate between the completion of the project delivery and handover to the service organization which greatly improved the quality of project transition and customer satisfaction. 
Updated the project management processes to incorporate a change management process and associated procedures which identified the business reason for a project change. 
Defined technical project manager roles and responsibilities. Manager of System Engineering Comverse March 1993  –  August 1996  (3 years 6 months) Managed successful growth of the group from 2 to over 15 System Engineers. 
Individually provided pre-sales technical support to domestic and international sales teams where over 60% of the opportunities were won 
 Responded to customer proposals  
 Consulted sales teams on Win strategy/approach for proposals 
Improved organizational efficiency and quality 
 Optimized engineering staff allocation by prioritizing opportunities  
 Improved cost projections and development budgeting from initial project cost estimation through development kickoff 
Provided post-sales support including the creation of requirement documents and on-going technical support 
 Defined processes for approval of customer requirement documents 
 Created a template to quickly define the system needs of a new customer which was quickly incorporated into the process of other organizations 
Contributed to Statement of Work and support contract negotiations. Performed vendor management. 
Generated test plans, test procedures and conducted functional testing.

Software Engineer in Test Microsoft October 2006  –  February 2013  (6 years 5 months) Redmond, Washington, USA Software Engineer in Test in Windows Networking – BranchCache team 
 During Windows 8: 
 Performance Owner of Windows DNT Org (Device and Networking Technologies). 
 Performance Champion of Wireless and Networking Services Org (Wi-Fi, Mobile Broadband, HTTP Protocols, DNS, BranchCache) organization.  
 Helped in designing, coding and testing BranchCache v2 (a distributed caching system for branch offices): 
 
 During Windows 7: 
 Worked with MSR-Asia and IT Admins to analyze traffic to find venues to bandwidth savings. This required analysis of the traffic of 10 different branch offices.  
 Owned major components in BranchCache (all code is in C# and C++). 
 
	During Windows Vista (only 6 months), Developed a distributed test harness PRIDE that has been used by many Windows networking teams. PRIDE allows synchronizing tasks between different processes that spread among multiple machines. It is partly based on my PhD. Research Associate University of Maryland August 2005  –  May 2006  (10 months) Developing a specification and testing environment for distributed systems based entirely on C#. This was funded by Microsoft Research; grant won based on a national competition in formal methods. Research and Teaching Assistant University of Maryland August 1997  –  August 2005  (8 years 1 month)  Developed a specification and testing environment for distributed systems based entirely on Java.  
 
 Used this environment to model, analyze and test network protocol implementations, specifically TCP/IP protocol. Used basically on Linux\Unix environment. 
 
 Teaching Computer Networks (5 semesters), Advanced Human Computer Interface, Neural Networks, Advanced Computer Graphics, Introduction to C. 
 
 Wrote the specification of the Gnutella peer-to-peer protocol. Then, used this environment to test that peer-to-peer implementations conform to the Gnutella protocol.  
 
 Used this environment in teaching introductory networking courses. The methodology was adopted by multiple universities. Summer Intern Telcordia Technologies April 2000  –  September 2000  (6 months)  Designed and implemented a system that allows web servers to send customized webpages depending on the capabilities of the requesting devices, for example, PDAs, laptops and phones. The project was written using C. 
 
 Investigated and designed a protocol that allows TCP segment transfer on the top of Bluetooth medium. Summer Intern Philips April 1998  –  September 1998  (6 months) Briarcliff Manor, New York, USA Designed and implemented video segmentor on mpeg standard. Video segmentor detects scene transitions and stores them separately in a database. Research Assistant Faculty of Engineering, Alexandria University, Egypt August 1994  –  August 1997  (3 years 1 month)  Designed and implemented a novel protocol for reading and writing to data with replicas in distributed systems. This protocol ensures global consistency of replicas.
